title: 107_hr5404
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. Section 202 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit payment upon death. The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" introduces a new provision regarding the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit payment upon death. This provision specifies that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their benefit amount will be reduced to 50% for that month. The provision states that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be reduced to 50% for that month. In cases where an individual dies in the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be 50% of the original amount for that month. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. The text discusses amendments to insurance benefits for spouses under the Social Security Act, including changes to wife's and husband's benefits. Amendments involve redesignating subparagraphs and making conforming adjustments. Amendments to insurance benefits under the Social Security Act include changes to spouse benefits, such as redesignating subparagraphs and making conforming adjustments. Amendments to widow's and widower's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act involve changes in the eligibility criteria, including the ending of benefits upon remarriage or death. Amendments to mother's, father's, and parent's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act involve changes in eligibility criteria, including the ending of benefits upon remarriage or death. Amendments to disability insurance benefits, benefits at age 72 for uninsured individuals, and exemption from maximum benefit cap under the Social Security Act. Exemption from maximum benefit cap under the Social Security Act is applied without considering benefits received in the month of an individual's death. Additionally, there is an increase in lump-sum death payments. Section 202(i) of the Social Security Act is amended to update the applicable dollar amount for calendar years, with the Commissioner determining and publishing the amount annually. The dollar amount for the next calendar year is determined by multiplying $955 by the ratio of the national average wage index for the previous year to the index for 2001. If the result is not a multiple of $5.00, it is rounded up to the nearest multiple of $5.00. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
